Sure, I'd be happy to explain how I improved your original writing. Here are some of the changes I made and why:

1. Changed the sentence structure to make it more natural: I rephrased some of your sentences to make them more natural and easier to read.
2. Used active voice: I changed some of your sentences from passive voice to active voice to make them more engaging and direct.
3. Replaced "utilized" with "used": "Utilized" is a formal word that can sound a bit stilted. "Used" is simpler and more natural.
4. Used contractions: I used contractions (e.g., "it's" instead of "it is") to make the writing more conversational.
5. Added specific details: I added more specific details to help illustrate your points and make the writing more interesting.
6. Used "I" instead of "me": When referring to oneself, it's more natural to use "I" instead of "me" (e.g., "I interviewed my friends" instead of "me interviewed my friends").

Overall, my goal was to make your writing more clear, concise, and natural-sounding, while still conveying your intended meaning.
